oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Lacy J. Dalton Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Lacy J. Dalton (performer), conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Lacy J. Dalton; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Lacy J Dalton and Biff Collie begin by Collie giving radio spots with Dalton repeating each directed line -- (03:11) Collie describes splicing audio and being a disc jockey to Dalton -- (04:51) Collie and Dalton discuss 'Lacy J.' album -- (07:05) Collie and Dalton discuss song titled 'Black Coffee' and transformation of what's considered "Country" -- (11:12) Dalton discusses the success of 'Black Coffee' and contributing artists -- (15:06) Dalton discusses compatibility with writing appointment partners -- (17:01) Dalton's song 'Third Rate Romance' and the freedom from judgement is discussed -- (19:06) Biff discusses his daughter's marriage and coming to terms with your partner-- (20:38) Collie and Dalton discuss 'Long Way Down' (22:05) Dalton's 'Lonesome As the Night is Long' is compared to Waylon Jennings -- (23:07) Collie and Dalton discuss why Dalton changed from original name to Lacy J. Dalton and influences of 'Lacy J.' -- (25:56) Dalton discusses 'Walk That Line' and Biff addresses natural approach to interviews -- (27:35) Dalton discusses the influence to song based on earthquake that occurred during recording -- (28:40) Dalton discusses fear associated with earthquake and unknown son's location-- (31:13) Collie has Dalton discuss Tom Skylar's '16th Avenue' and discusses Dalton's experience after the songs release -- (33:30) 'Missing the Road' is discussed and Dalton tries to describe her connection to the road life -- (35:15) Dalton discusses most unforgettable character "Tiny Boil"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Collie, Biff; Dalton, Lacy J.; Dalton, Lacy J., 1946-;
